a machine readable transcription

availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. notesStmt.note: The manuscript leaf is mounted on a backing sheet, making the verso inaccessible.

This manuscript was likely composed before or just after June 20, 1863. Whitman notes here that soldier Albion F. Hubbard is healing, but at the end of the paragraph, he records Hubbard's death date as June 20, 1863. The notes on Hubbard's condition may have been recorded before or just after Hubbard's death date.
The following are responsible for particular readings or for changes to this file, as noted: Elizabeth Lorang Ashley Lawson Tim Jackson

revisionDesc.change: removed brackets from title, updated note about verso

body.ab: —has had two carbuncles one on arm, one on ancleankle, healing at present yet great holes left, stuffed with rags
—worked on a farm 8 years before enlisting

add.ab: —wrote letter for him to the man he lived with
